title: CLAUDE.md
text: Guidance agents.

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Always keep file date.

title: CLAUDE.md
text: project R package called swadlr retrieves data undocumented EPI State Working America Data Library: https://data.epi.org main users package want grab time series value EPI SWADL, either use directly benchmark another calculation.

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Returns tibble (data frame long format).
code: get_swadl(     indicator,     measure,     date_interval = c("year", "month"),     geography = "national",     dimension = "overall",     date = NULL )

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Return structured summary indicator. Returns S3 object class swadl_indicator_info nice print method.
code: swadl_indicator(indicator)

title: CLAUDE.md
text: List ID-name mappings topics, indicators, measures, dimensions, geographies.
code: swadl_id_names(what = c("topics", "indicators", "measures", "dimensions", "geographies"))

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Search data availability across indicators.
code: swadl_availability(indicator, measure, date_interval, geo_level, dimensions, dimensions_match)

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Clear cached metadata.
code: clear_swadlr_cache()

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Tests use httptest2 mock API responses fixtures tests/testthat/fixtures/. avoids hitting live API tests. Key points: - httptest2 intercepts httr2 requests req_perform() returns fixture data - throttle (throttle_if_needed()) runs request, still delay even mocked responses - tests/testthat/setup.R sets options(swadlr.throttle_interval = 0) disable throttling tests - Use testthat::test_path("fixtures") with_mock_dir() calls ensure correct path resolution devtools::test() update fixtures live API changes:
code: httptest2::start_capturing("tests/testthat/fixtures") devtools::test() httptest2::stop_capturing()

title: CLAUDE.md
text: codebase follows naming conventions internal functions: fetch_* - Functions make HTTP requests (e.g., fetch_indicators(), fetch_data()) get_* - Functions extract compute cached data (e.g., get_indicator_availability(), get_geo_level()) resolve_* - Lookup translation functions (e.g., resolve_geography(), resolve_dimension()) build_* - Constructor functions create data structures (e.g., build_indicator_info(), build_availability_summary()) validate_* - Functions check inputs throw errors invalid values (e.g., validate_indicator(), validate_measure()) filter_* - Functions filter data frames criteria (e.g., filter_availability(), filter_by_dimensions())

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: fetching data, can explore ’s available SWADL API using swadl_id_names().

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: Topics broad categories group related indicators:
code: swadl_id_names("topics")

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: Indicators specific data series. can list indicators filter topic:
code: # List all indicators swadl_id_names("indicators")  # List indicators for a specific topic swadl_id_names("indicators", topic = "wages")

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: Measures specific ways presenting indicator data. example, wage data might available nominal dollars, real (inflation-adjusted) dollars, percentage:
code: # List all measures swadl_id_names("measures")  # List measures for a specific indicator swadl_id_names("measures", indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles")

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: Dimensions allow subsetting data demographic categories (e.g., gender, race, education). dimension multiple values:
code: # List all dimensions and their values swadl_id_names("dimensions")  # List dimensions for a specific indicator swadl_id_names("dimensions", indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles")

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: package supports national, regional, divisional, state-level data:
code: # List all geographies swadl_id_names("geographies")  # Filter to just states geographies <- swadl_id_names("geographies") geographies[geographies$level == "state", ]

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: fetching data, use swadl_indicator() get detailed information indicator, including available measures, dimensions, date ranges, geographic availability: can also access specific components info object:
code: info <- swadl_indicator("hourly_wage_percentiles") print(info) # Available measures info$measures  # Availability by date interval, measure, and geography info$availability

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: main function fetching data get_swadl(). returns tibble columns date, value, geography, dimensions request.

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: Fetch median hourly wage time:
code: wages <- get_swadl(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "nominal_wage",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50") ) wages

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: dimension argument supports several formats: Overall (aggregate data): Use "overall" get aggregate data without demographic breakdown: Single dimension (values): Pass dimension ID get values dimension: Single dimension (specific value): Use named list filter specific dimension values: Multiple dimensions (cross-tabulated): Combine dimensions using list. Named elements filter specific values, unnamed elements include values:
code: get_swadl(   indicator = "labor_force_emp",   measure = "percent_emp",    dimension = "overall" ) # All wage percentiles get_swadl(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "nominal_wage",   dimension = "wage_percentile" ) # Only the 90th percentile get_swadl(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "nominal_wage",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p90") ) # Employment rate for males, by all age groups get_swadl(   indicator = "labor_force_emp",   measure = "percent_emp",   date_interval = "month",   dimension = list("gender" = "gender_male", "age_group") )

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: indicators support annual monthly data. Use date_interval argument:
code: # Annual data (default) get_swadl(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "nominal_wage",   date_interval = "year",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50") )  # Monthly data get_swadl(   indicator = "labor_force_emp",   measure = "percent_emp",   date_interval = "month",   dimension = "overall" )

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: Fetch data different geographic levels:
code: # National data (default) get_swadl(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "nominal_wage",   geography = "national",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50") )  # State data (by name) get_swadl(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "nominal_wage",   geography = "California",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50") )  # State data (by abbreviation) get_swadl(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "nominal_wage",   geography = "NY",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50") )  # Census region get_swadl(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "nominal_wage",   geography = "Midwest",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50") )

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: Filter specific dates date ranges:
code: # Single date get_swadl(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "nominal_wage",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50"),   date = "2023-01-01" )  # Date range get_swadl(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "nominal_wage",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50"),   date = c("2010-01-01", "2023-01-01") )

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: ’s complete example fetches wage percentiles creates summary:
code: # Fetch all wage percentiles wages <- get_swadl(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "nominal_wage",   dimension = "wage_percentile",   date = c("2000-01-01", "2023-01-01") )  # View the data head(wages)  # Summary by percentile aggregate(value ~ wage_percentile, data = wages, FUN = function(x) {   c(start = x[1], end = x[length(x)], change = x[length(x)] - x[1]) })

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: Fetch employment rates states available data:
code: # Get info to see which geographic levels have data info <- swadl_indicator("labor_force_emp") info$availability  # Fetch data for California ca_emp <- get_swadl(   indicator = "labor_force_emp",   measure = "percent_emp",   date_interval = "year",   geography = "California",   dimension = "overall" ) ca_emp

title: Getting started with swadlr
text: package caches metadata (topics, indicators, measures, dimensions, sources) within R session minimize API calls. need refresh cache:
code: clear_swadlr_cache()

title: Authors and Citation
text: Ben Zipperer. Author, maintainer. Economic Policy Institute. Copyright holder, funder.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Zipperer B (2026). swadlr: Access EPI State Working America Data Library API. R package version 0.1.0, https://economic.github.io/swadlr/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {swadlr: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API},   author = {Ben Zipperer},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://economic.github.io/swadlr/}, }

what: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API
title: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API
text: swadlr provides access EPI State Working America Data Library (SWADL) API.

title: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API
text: Use swadlr need programmatically retrieve time series SWADL: summary available given indicator need retrieve many time series, don’t use API. Instead, simply download data.
code: library(swadlr)  get_swadl(   indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles",   measure = "nominal_wage",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50") ) #> # A tibble: 53 × 4 #>    date       value geography wage_percentile #>    <date>     <dbl> <chr>     <chr>           #>  1 1973-01-01  3.35 national  wage_p50        #>  2 1974-01-01  3.62 national  wage_p50        #>  3 1975-01-01  3.94 national  wage_p50        #>  4 1976-01-01  4.12 national  wage_p50        #>  5 1977-01-01  4.41 national  wage_p50        #>  6 1978-01-01  4.73 national  wage_p50        #>  7 1979-01-01  5.11 national  wage_p50        #>  8 1980-01-01  5.63 national  wage_p50        #>  9 1981-01-01  6.10 national  wage_p50        #> 10 1982-01-01  6.46 national  wage_p50        #> # ℹ 43 more rows swadl_indicator("hourly_wage_percentiles") #>  #> ── Indicator ── #>  #> • Name: Hourly wage percentiles #> • Topic: wages #> • Last updated: 2026-01-23 #>  #> ── Measures ── #>  #> ID              Name                      Format #> real_wage_2025  Real hourly wage (2025$)  dollar #> nominal_wage    Nominal hourly wage       dollar #>  #> ── Dimensions by geography ── #>  #> division (up to 2-way) #>   education × wage_percentile, gender × wage_percentile, race × wage_percentile, wage_percentile #> national (up to 3-way) #>   age_group × wage_percentile, education × wage_percentile, gender × wage_percentile, nativity × wage_percentile, public_sector × wage_percentile, race × wage_percentile, ... (12 total) #> region (up to 2-way) #>   education × wage_percentile, gender × wage_percentile, race × wage_percentile, wage_percentile #> state (up to 2-way) #>   education × wage_percentile, gender × wage_percentile, race × wage_percentile, wage_percentile #>  #> ── Dates ── #>  #> • Annual: 1973 — 2025 #> • Quarterly: Not available #> • Monthly: Not available #>  #> ── Sources ── #>  #> • real_wage_2025: Deflated using the extended Chained CPI-U #> • (all): Current Population Survey, EPI extracts

title: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API
text: can install swadlr r-universe:
code: install.packages(   "swadlr",   repos = c("https://economic.r-universe.dev", "https://cloud.r-project.org") )

title: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API
text: See package website full documentation Getting started vignette examples.

title: Clear the swadlr cache — clear_swadlr_cache
text: Clears cached metadata current R session. includes cached topics, indicators, measures, dimensions, sources. Use function want refresh metadata API.

title: Clear the swadlr cache — clear_swadlr_cache
code: clear_swadlr_cache()

title: Clear the swadlr cache — clear_swadlr_cache
text: Invisible NULL.

title: Clear the swadlr cache — clear_swadlr_cache
code: # \donttest{ clear_swadlr_cache() # }

what: Get time series data from SWADL — get_swadl
title: Get time series data from SWADL — get_swadl
text: Retrieves time series data EPI State Working America Data Library API.

title: Get time series data from SWADL — get_swadl
code: get_swadl(   indicator,   measure,   date_interval = c("year", "month"),   geography = "national",   dimension = "overall",   date = NULL )

title: Get time series data from SWADL — get_swadl
text: indicator Indicator ID (e.g., "hourly_wage_percentiles"). Use swadl_id_names() see available indicators. measure Measure ID (e.g., "nominal_wage"). Use swadl_id_names() swadl_indicator() see available measures. date_interval Either "year" "month". Defaults "year". geography geography specification. Accepts state names (e.g., "California"), abbreviations (e.g., "CA"), region names (e.g., "Midwest"), division names (e.g., "Pacific"), API IDs (e.g., "state06"). Defaults "national". dimension Dimension specification. Can : "overall": Returns aggregate data without demographic breakdown dimension ID (e.g., "wage_percentile"): Returns values dimension list named /unnamed elements: Named elements filter specific values: list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50") Unnamed elements return values: list("wage_percentile") Multiple dimensions can cross-tabulated, one dimension can return values; others must specify values: list("gender" = "gender_male", "age_group") date Optional date filter. Can : NULL (default): available dates single date (character Date): Returns date vector two dates: Returns dates range (inclusive)

title: Get time series data from SWADL — get_swadl
text: tibble columns: date: Observation date value: observed value geography: Geography ID One column per dimension request, containing dimension value IDs

title: Get time series data from SWADL — get_swadl
code: # \donttest{ # Median hourly wage over time get_swadl(   "hourly_wage_percentiles",   "nominal_wage",   dimension = list("wage_percentile" = "wage_p50") ) #> # A tibble: 53 × 4 #>    date       value geography wage_percentile #>    <date>     <dbl> <chr>     <chr>           #>  1 1973-01-01  3.35 national  wage_p50        #>  2 1974-01-01  3.62 national  wage_p50        #>  3 1975-01-01  3.94 national  wage_p50        #>  4 1976-01-01  4.12 national  wage_p50        #>  5 1977-01-01  4.41 national  wage_p50        #>  6 1978-01-01  4.73 national  wage_p50        #>  7 1979-01-01  5.11 national  wage_p50        #>  8 1980-01-01  5.63 national  wage_p50        #>  9 1981-01-01  6.10 national  wage_p50        #> 10 1982-01-01  6.46 national  wage_p50        #> # ℹ 43 more rows  # All wage percentiles get_swadl(   "hourly_wage_percentiles",   "nominal_wage",   dimension = "wage_percentile" ) #> # A tibble: 477 × 4 #>    date       value geography wage_percentile #>    <date>     <dbl> <chr>     <chr>           #>  1 1973-01-01  1.72 national  wage_p10        #>  2 1973-01-01  6.51 national  wage_p90        #>  3 1973-01-01  5.17 national  wage_p80        #>  4 1973-01-01  4.48 national  wage_p70        #>  5 1973-01-01  3.87 national  wage_p60        #>  6 1973-01-01  3.35 national  wage_p50        #>  7 1973-01-01  2.91 national  wage_p40        #>  8 1973-01-01  2.47 national  wage_p30        #>  9 1973-01-01  2.06 national  wage_p20        #> 10 1974-01-01  1.95 national  wage_p10        #> # ℹ 467 more rows  # Employment rate for males by age group get_swadl(   "labor_force_emp",   "percent_emp",   dimension = list("gender" = "gender_male", "age_group") ) #> # A tibble: 150 × 5 #>    date       value geography gender      age_group   #>    <date>     <dbl> <chr>     <chr>       <chr>       #>  1 1976-01-01 0.624 national  gender_male age_16_24   #>  2 1976-01-01 0.460 national  gender_male age_55_plus #>  3 1976-01-01 0.895 national  gender_male age_25_54   #>  4 1977-01-01 0.644 national  gender_male age_16_24   #>  5 1977-01-01 0.457 national  gender_male age_55_plus #>  6 1977-01-01 0.902 national  gender_male age_25_54   #>  7 1978-01-01 0.460 national  gender_male age_55_plus #>  8 1978-01-01 0.911 national  gender_male age_25_54   #>  9 1978-01-01 0.663 national  gender_male age_16_24   #> 10 1979-01-01 0.456 national  gender_male age_55_plus #> # ℹ 140 more rows  # Filter to specific date range get_swadl(   "hourly_wage_percentiles",   "nominal_wage",   dimension = "wage_percentile",   date = c("2000-01-01", "2024-01-01") ) #> # A tibble: 225 × 4 #>    date       value geography wage_percentile #>    <date>     <dbl> <chr>     <chr>           #>  1 2000-01-01  6.14 national  wage_p10        #>  2 2000-01-01 27.0  national  wage_p90        #>  3 2000-01-01 20.6  national  wage_p80        #>  4 2000-01-01 16.9  national  wage_p70        #>  5 2000-01-01 14.2  national  wage_p60        #>  6 2000-01-01 12.0  national  wage_p50        #>  7 2000-01-01 10.2  national  wage_p40        #>  8 2000-01-01  8.85 national  wage_p30        #>  9 2000-01-01  7.46 national  wage_p20        #> 10 2001-01-01  6.49 national  wage_p10        #> # ℹ 215 more rows # }

what: Find available data across all indicators — swadl_availability
title: Find available data across all indicators — swadl_availability
text: Searches across indicators find data available matching specified criteria. Useful answering questions like "indicators state-level data race?"

title: Find available data across all indicators — swadl_availability
code: swadl_availability(   indicator = NULL,   measure = NULL,   date_interval = NULL,   geo_level = NULL,   dimensions = NULL,   dimensions_match = c("exact", "all", "any") )

title: Find available data across all indicators — swadl_availability
text: indicator Character vector indicator IDs filter . NULL (default), includes indicators. measure Character vector measure IDs filter . NULL (default), includes measures. date_interval Character vector date intervals filter . Valid values "year", "quarter", "month". NULL (default), includes date intervals. geo_level Character vector geographic levels filter . Valid values "national", "state", "division". NULL (default), includes geographic levels. dimensions Character vector dimension IDs match. matched depends dimensions_match. NULL (default), dimension filtering applied. dimensions_match match dimensions argument: "exact" dimensions column must exactly match provided dimensions (order-insensitive). example, c("gender", "race") matches "gender × race" "age_group × gender × race". "" dimensions column must contain provided dimensions (may contain ). example, c("gender", "race") matches "gender × race" "age_group × gender × race". "" dimensions column must contain provided dimensions. example, c("gender", "race") matches "gender", "race", "gender × race", "age_group × gender".

title: Find available data across all indicators — swadl_availability
text: tibble columns: indicator_id Indicator identifier indicator_name Human-readable indicator name date_interval "year", "quarter", "month" measure_id Measure identifier geo_level "national", "state", "division" dimensions Dimension combination (e.g., "gender × race") "overall" aggregate data date_start Start available date range date_end End available date range

title: Find available data across all indicators — swadl_availability
code: # \donttest{ # Find all indicators with state-level gender data swadl_availability(geo_level = "state", dimensions = "gender",   dimensions_match = "any") #> # A tibble: 87 × 8 #>    indicator_id     indicator_name date_interval measure_id geo_level dimensions #>    <chr>            <chr>          <chr>         <chr>      <chr>     <chr>      #>  1 hourly_wage_mean Hourly wage, … year          nominal_w… state     gender     #>  2 hourly_wage_mean Hourly wage, … year          real_wage… state     gender     #>  3 hourly_wage_med… Hourly wage, … year          nominal_w… state     gender     #>  4 hourly_wage_med… Hourly wage, … year          real_wage… state     gender     #>  5 hourly_wage_per… Hourly wage p… year          wage_ratio state     gender × … #>  6 hourly_wage_per… Hourly wage p… year          nominal_w… state     gender × … #>  7 hourly_wage_per… Hourly wage p… year          real_wage… state     gender × … #>  8 labor_force_emp  Employment by… month         count_emp… state     gender     #>  9 labor_force_emp  Employment by… month         dist_shar… state     gender     #> 10 labor_force_emp  Employment by… month         percent_e… state     gender     #> # ℹ 77 more rows #> # ℹ 2 more variables: date_start <date>, date_end <date>  # Find indicators with a specific measure swadl_availability(measure = "percent_emp") #> # A tibble: 33 × 8 #>    indicator_id    indicator_name  date_interval measure_id geo_level dimensions #>    <chr>           <chr>           <chr>         <chr>      <chr>     <chr>      #>  1 labor_force_emp Employment by … year          percent_e… division  age_group  #>  2 labor_force_emp Employment by … year          percent_e… division  education  #>  3 labor_force_emp Employment by … year          percent_e… division  fpl200     #>  4 labor_force_emp Employment by … year          percent_e… division  gender     #>  5 labor_force_emp Employment by … year          percent_e… division  race       #>  6 labor_force_emp Employment by … year          percent_e… division  overall    #>  7 labor_force_emp Employment by … year          percent_e… national  age_group… #>  8 labor_force_emp Employment by … year          percent_e… national  age_group… #>  9 labor_force_emp Employment by … year          percent_e… national  age_group… #> 10 labor_force_emp Employment by … year          percent_e… national  age_group… #> # ℹ 23 more rows #> # ℹ 2 more variables: date_start <date>, date_end <date>  # Find all availability for a specific indicator swadl_availability(indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles") #> # A tibble: 48 × 8 #>    indicator_id     indicator_name date_interval measure_id geo_level dimensions #>    <chr>            <chr>          <chr>         <chr>      <chr>     <chr>      #>  1 hourly_wage_per… Hourly wage p… year          nominal_w… division  education… #>  2 hourly_wage_per… Hourly wage p… year          nominal_w… division  gender × … #>  3 hourly_wage_per… Hourly wage p… year          nominal_w… division  race × wa… #>  4 hourly_wage_per… Hourly wage p… year          nominal_w… division  wage_perc… #>  5 hourly_wage_per… Hourly wage p… year          nominal_w… national  age_group… #>  6 hourly_wage_per… Hourly wage p… year          nominal_w… national  age_group… #>  7 hourly_wage_per… Hourly wage p… year          nominal_w… national  age_group… #>  8 hourly_wage_per… Hourly wage p… year          nominal_w… national  education… #>  9 hourly_wage_per… Hourly wage p… year          nominal_w… national  education… #> 10 hourly_wage_per… Hourly wage p… year          nominal_w… national  gender × … #> # ℹ 38 more rows #> # ℹ 2 more variables: date_start <date>, date_end <date>  # Find indicators with exact "gender × race" combinations at national level swadl_availability(geo_level = "national",   dimensions = c("gender", "race"), dimensions_match = "exact") #> # A tibble: 59 × 8 #>    indicator_id     indicator_name date_interval measure_id geo_level dimensions #>    <chr>            <chr>          <chr>         <chr>      <chr>     <chr>      #>  1 hourly_wage_mean Hourly wage, … year          nominal_w… national  gender × … #>  2 hourly_wage_mean Hourly wage, … year          real_wage… national  gender × … #>  3 hourly_wage_med… Hourly wage, … year          nominal_w… national  gender × … #>  4 hourly_wage_med… Hourly wage, … year          real_wage… national  gender × … #>  5 labor_force_ann… Time at work   year          hours_wor… national  gender × … #>  6 labor_force_ann… Time at work   year          hours_wor… national  gender × … #>  7 labor_force_ann… Time at work   year          weeks_wor… national  gender × … #>  8 labor_force_emp  Employment by… month         count_emp… national  gender × … #>  9 labor_force_emp  Employment by… month         percent_e… national  gender × … #> 10 labor_force_emp  Employment by… year          count_emp  national  gender × … #> # ℹ 49 more rows #> # ℹ 2 more variables: date_start <date>, date_end <date> # }

what: List ID-name mappings for SWADL metadata — swadl_id_names
title: List ID-name mappings for SWADL metadata — swadl_id_names
text: Returns tibble ID-name mappings SWADL metadata. Use understand ID represents.

title: List ID-name mappings for SWADL metadata — swadl_id_names
code: swadl_id_names(   what = c("topics", "indicators", "measures", "dimensions", "geographies"),   topic = NULL,   indicator = NULL )

title: List ID-name mappings for SWADL metadata — swadl_id_names
text: type metadata list. One : "topics" Broad categories group related indicators "indicators" Specific data series can retrieved get_swadl() "measures" Ways presenting indicator data (e.g., nominal vs real wages) "dimensions" Demographic categories subsetting data (e.g., gender, race) "geographies" Geographic units (national, regions, divisions, states) topic = "indicators", optionally filter specific topic ID. indicator = "measures" = "dimensions", optionally filter available specific indicator ID.

title: List ID-name mappings for SWADL metadata — swadl_id_names
text: tibble. columns depend : topics id, name indicators id, name, topic_id, updated_date measures id, name, format dimensions dimension_id, dimension_name, value_id, value_name geographies id, level, name, abbr

title: List ID-name mappings for SWADL metadata — swadl_id_names
code: # \donttest{ # List all topics swadl_id_names("topics") #> # A tibble: 9 × 2 #>   id           name             #>   <chr>        <chr>            #> 1 labor_force  Employment       #> 2 minimum_wage Minimum wages    #> 3 population   Population       #> 4 poverty      Poverty          #> 5 prices       Prices           #> 6 productivity Productivity     #> 7 unions       Unions           #> 8 wage_gaps    Wage disparities #> 9 wages        Wages             # List all indicators swadl_id_names("indicators") #> # A tibble: 36 × 4 #>    id                             name                     topic_id updated_date #>    <chr>                          <chr>                    <chr>    <chr>        #>  1 annual_wage_ssa                Annual wages for select… wages    2026-01-23   #>  2 ceo_pay_ratio                  CEO pay ratio            wage_ga… 2026-01-23   #>  3 hourly_wage_mean               Hourly wage, average     wages    2026-01-23   #>  4 hourly_wage_median             Hourly wage, median      wages    2026-01-23   #>  5 hourly_wage_payroll            Hourly earnings by indu… wages    2026-01-23   #>  6 hourly_wage_percentile_ratios  Hourly wage percentile … wages    2026-01-23   #>  7 hourly_wage_percentiles        Hourly wage percentiles  wages    2026-01-23   #>  8 hourly_wage_gap_black_white    Black-white wage gap     wage_ga… 2026-01-23   #>  9 hourly_wage_gap_gender         Gender wage gap          wage_ga… 2026-01-23   #> 10 hourly_wage_gap_hispanic_white Hispanic-white wage gap  wage_ga… 2026-01-23   #> # ℹ 26 more rows  # List indicators for a specific topic swadl_id_names("indicators", topic = "wages") #> # A tibble: 6 × 4 #>   id                            name                       topic_id updated_date #>   <chr>                         <chr>                      <chr>    <chr>        #> 1 annual_wage_ssa               Annual wages for select w… wages    2026-01-23   #> 2 hourly_wage_mean              Hourly wage, average       wages    2026-01-23   #> 3 hourly_wage_median            Hourly wage, median        wages    2026-01-23   #> 4 hourly_wage_payroll           Hourly earnings by indust… wages    2026-01-23   #> 5 hourly_wage_percentile_ratios Hourly wage percentile ra… wages    2026-01-23   #> 6 hourly_wage_percentiles       Hourly wage percentiles    wages    2026-01-23    # List measures for a specific indicator swadl_id_names("measures", indicator = "hourly_wage_percentiles") #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   id             name                     format #>   <chr>          <chr>                    <chr>  #> 1 real_wage_2025 Real hourly wage (2025$) dollar #> 2 nominal_wage   Nominal hourly wage      dollar  # List dimensions swadl_id_names("dimensions") #> # A tibble: 85 × 4 #>    dimension_id   dimension_name value_id       value_name                       #>    <chr>          <chr>          <chr>          <chr>                            #>  1 age_group      Age            age_16_24      16–24 years                      #>  2 age_group      Age            age_25_54      25–54 years                      #>  3 age_group      Age            age_55_64      55–64 years                      #>  4 age_group      Age            age_55_plus    55+ years                        #>  5 ces_industry   All sectors    ces_nonfarm    Total nonfarm                    #>  6 ces_government Government     ces_fed        Federal government               #>  7 ces_government Government     ces_government Government                       #>  8 ces_government Government     ces_local      Local government                 #>  9 ces_government Government     ces_local_ed   Local government educational se… #> 10 ces_government Government     ces_local_noed Local government, excluding edu… #> # ℹ 75 more rows  # List geographies swadl_id_names("geographies") #> # A tibble: 65 × 4 #>    id              level    name               abbr  #>    <chr>           <chr>    <chr>              <chr> #>  1 national        national United States      US    #>  2 regionMidwest   region   Midwest            NA    #>  3 regionNortheast region   Northeast          NA    #>  4 regionSouth     region   South              NA    #>  5 regionWest      region   West               NA    #>  6 division01      division New England        NA    #>  7 division02      division Middle Atlantic    NA    #>  8 division03      division East North Central NA    #>  9 division04      division West North Central NA    #> 10 division05      division South Atlantic     NA    #> # ℹ 55 more rows # }

what: Get detailed information about an indicator — swadl_indicator
title: Get detailed information about an indicator — swadl_indicator
text: Returns detailed information specific indicator including available measures, dimension combinations, date ranges, geographic availability, sources.

title: Get detailed information about an indicator — swadl_indicator
code: swadl_indicator(indicator)

title: Get detailed information about an indicator — swadl_indicator
text: indicator indicator ID (e.g., "hourly_wage_percentiles"). Use swadl_id_names() see available indicators.

title: Get detailed information about an indicator — swadl_indicator
text: S3 object class swadl_indicator_info following components: id Indicator identifier name Human-readable indicator name topic Topic ID indicator belongs updated Date indicator last updated measures Tibble available measures columns: id, name, format availability Tibble availability information columns: date_interval, measure_id, geo_level, dimensions, date_start, date_end. dimensions column contains dimension IDs joined x (using multiplication sign), "overall" aggregate data. sources Tibble sources columns: measure_id, source, url

title: Get detailed information about an indicator — swadl_indicator
code: # \donttest{ # Get information about hourly wage percentiles info <- swadl_indicator("hourly_wage_percentiles") print(info) #>  #> ── Indicator ── #>  #> • Name: Hourly wage percentiles #> • Topic: wages #> • Last updated: 2026-01-23 #>  #> ── Measures ── #>  #> ID              Name                      Format #> real_wage_2025  Real hourly wage (2025$)  dollar #> nominal_wage    Nominal hourly wage       dollar #>  #> ── Dimensions by geography ── #>  #> division (up to 2-way) #>   education × wage_percentile, gender × wage_percentile, race × wage_percentile, wage_percentile #> national (up to 3-way) #>   age_group × wage_percentile, education × wage_percentile, gender × wage_percentile, nativity × wage_percentile, public_sector × wage_percentile, race × wage_percentile, ... (12 total) #> region (up to 2-way) #>   education × wage_percentile, gender × wage_percentile, race × wage_percentile, wage_percentile #> state (up to 2-way) #>   education × wage_percentile, gender × wage_percentile, race × wage_percentile, wage_percentile #>  #> ── Dates ── #>  #> • Annual: 1973 — 2025 #> • Quarterly: Not available #> • Monthly: Not available #>  #> ── Sources ── #>  #> • real_wage_2025: Deflated using the extended Chained CPI-U #> • (all): Current Population Survey, EPI extracts  # Access specific components info$measures #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   id             name                     format #>   <chr>          <chr>                    <chr>  #> 1 real_wage_2025 Real hourly wage (2025$) dollar #> 2 nominal_wage   Nominal hourly wage      dollar info$availability #> # A tibble: 48 × 6 #>    date_interval measure_id   geo_level dimensions         date_start date_end   #>    <chr>         <chr>        <chr>     <chr>              <date>     <date>     #>  1 year          nominal_wage division  education × wage_… 1978-01-01 2025-01-01 #>  2 year          nominal_wage division  gender × wage_per… 1978-01-01 2025-01-01 #>  3 year          nominal_wage division  race × wage_perce… 1978-01-01 2025-01-01 #>  4 year          nominal_wage division  wage_percentile    1978-01-01 2025-01-01 #>  5 year          nominal_wage national  age_group × gende… 1973-01-01 2025-01-01 #>  6 year          nominal_wage national  age_group × race … 1973-01-01 2025-01-01 #>  7 year          nominal_wage national  age_group × wage_… 1973-01-01 2025-01-01 #>  8 year          nominal_wage national  education × wage_… 1973-01-01 2025-01-01 #>  9 year          nominal_wage national  education × gende… 1973-01-01 2025-01-01 #> 10 year          nominal_wage national  gender × wage_per… 1973-01-01 2025-01-01 #> # ℹ 38 more rows # }

what: swadlr: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API — swadlr-package
title: swadlr: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API — swadlr-package
text: swadlr package provides access Economic Policy Institute's State Working America Data Library (SWADL) API. enables users explore available indicators, measures, dimensions, fetch time series data national, regional, state levels.

title: swadlr: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API — swadlr-package
text: main function fetching data get_swadl(), returns time series data specified indicator, measure, geography, dimension combination.

title: swadlr: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API — swadlr-package
text: Use swadl_indicator() get detailed information indicator, including available measures, dimensions, date ranges, geographic availability.

title: swadlr: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API — swadlr-package
text: Use swadl_id_names() list available topics, indicators, measures, dimensions, geographies. Use swadl_availability() search data matching specific criteria.

title: swadlr: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API — swadlr-package
text: Metadata cached within R session. Use clear_swadlr_cache() refresh cache needed.

title: swadlr: Access the EPI State of Working America Data Library API — swadlr-package
text: Maintainer: Ben Zipperer benzipperer@gmail.com contributors: Economic Policy Institute [copyright holder, funder]

title: swadlr 0.1.0
text: first hopefully functional release
